intro: Clinostigma surculosum, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its unique morphology and adaptability to various habitats make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
